title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Labor is teaming up with the Greens to force changes to asylum seeker policy. As many as 4,000 migrants who arrived by boat could stay in the country for more than 500 days, under a deal to scrap fast-track processing. The Coalition established the regime in 2015 to work through a backlog of legacy cases from previous Labor governments. Shadow Home Affairs Minister Kristina Keneally is pushing to scrap the changes over concerns asylum seekers aren't being treated fairly. Image: News Corp Australia
